component.name: gPodder-adaptive
component.summary: Media aggregator and podcast client for mobile and desktop alike

description.p: gPodder lets you manage your Podcast subscriptions, discover new content and download episodes to your devices.
You can also take advantage of the service gpodder.net, which lets you sync subscriptions, playback progress and starred episodes.
This is a version of gPodder with an adaptive interface meant for both touchscreen devices, like phones and tablets, and desktop and laptop computers.

ul.li: Replace context GtkMenus with GtkPopovers (#1293)
Add PotPlayer Support For Windows (#1583)
New subscription statistics extension (#1590)
Group subscriptions in OPML import/export (#1658)
Add `path.alternate` setting so users can append to PATH inside gpodder (#1649)
Limit the length of UTF-8 filenames (#1645)
Sort episodes by published date when sending to folder (#1624)
Add view menu podcast and episode list checkboxes to preferences (#1618)
New podverse search extension (#1615)
SendTo automatic rename filename (#1620)
Add socks proxy to settings and network tab in Preferences (#1592)
Extract YouTube channel ID from URL (#1603)
Modernize userappsdirs (#1601)
Add color scheme (dark and light mode) support (#1595)
Change %d to %ld in Windows launcher (#1589)
Add forceDownload action to Downloads context menu and toolbar
Context menus are now identical to classic gPodder
Use the new design of 'Discover new podcasts' dialog from classic gPodder with small tweaks

description.p: This release only updates dependencies in the Windows and Mac builds

ul.li: Add 'Preview' item to download context menu
Enable text selection in shownotes for non-touchscreen use
fix crash when syncing
don't reposition maximised windows
new yt-dlp to fix the recent YouTube change
fix multiple bugs that caused gPodder to freeze or appear frozen
embed subtitles in videos with youtube-dl extension
performance improvements

description.p: This release contains a year's worth of improvements. Major changes:

ul.li: Warning: There is a database schema update (See "Moving to an older gPodder release" in the user manual at gpodder.github.io for how to rollback)
Numerous bug fixes
Performance improvements
A new preferences dialog
Support again syncing to mtp:// and iPod devices on Linux
Context menus are now identical to master
Show a menu on channel list on top edge overshot
Swipe-down to go-back on leaflet scrolled windows using edge overshot
Lots of other small fixes
